snippet: Janet Napolitano, who has overseen an expansive portfolio as President Obama’s secretary of homeland security, plans to become president of the University of California system.
abstract: Homeland Security Secretary Janet Napolitano announces she is stepping down, setting off search to fill one of the most challenging positions in government; departure comes as Pres Obama's administration is struggling to get a team in place for his second term.

byline.original: By PETER BAKER and TAMAR LEWIN
byline.contributor: Peter Baker reported from Washington, and Tamar Lewin from New York. Michael S. Schmidt and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Janet Napolitano, who has overseen an expansive portfolio as President Obama’s secretary of homeland security, plans to become president of the University of California system.

headline.main: Napolitano Stepping Down as Homeland Security Chief
